conversation.message: Hello School_E admissions committee—I'm Student_B. School_E is my first-choice school because I strongly value the programs and overall fit. I would be excited to commit if offered a seat. Thank you for considering my application.
conversation.thought: My top choice is School_E, so I should apply immediately. Although School_E’s priority list ranks me 4th, applying now gives me a chance before they commit to higher-priority applicants. If rejected, I can move to my next choices (School_A, then School_B) in later rounds.

conversation.message:
Dear Student_B,

Thank you for your application and for sharing that School_E is your first choice. After reviewing our priorities for this round and given our limited capacity, we’re not able to offer you admission at this time.

We appreciate your interest in School_E and wish you the best in the rest of the process.

Sincerely,
School_E Admissions
conversation.thought: Student_B is 4th on School_E’s true priority list (A, D, E, B, C). With quota 1, accepting B now risks losing a higher-priority student (A/D/E) who may apply later. Given preferences: A ranks E 4th, D ranks E 5th (unlikely), E ranks E 2nd (likely if rejected by D), C ranks E 3rd. So Student_E is a credible higher-priority candidate who may come to us soon. Therefore reject B to preserve the seat for a higher-priority applicant.

conversation.message: Hello School_D admissions—I'm Student_D. School_D is my first-choice school, and if you accept my application I will commit immediately. I’m excited about the chance to join and contribute to your community.
conversation.thought: My top choice is School_D. I also have strong priority there (2nd, behind Student_B). In a one-shot apply/accept setting, applying immediately maximizes my chance to lock in my first choice before the seat is taken by others who also rank School_D highly (Students A, C, E). I will apply and emphasize School_D is my first choice and I will commit if accepted.

conversation.message: Student_D, thank you for your application and for your strong interest in School_D. After reviewing applications received this round, we’re not able to offer you admission at this time. We appreciate your commitment and wish you the best in the process.
conversation.thought: As School_D with quota 1, my true priority ranking is B > D > E > C > A. In this round I received APPLY messages from D, E, A, and C. Student_D is my #2 choice, but I should not commit yet because Student_B (my #1) is still unmatched and ranks School_D 4th, meaning they may apply later if rejected elsewhere. Accepting D now would lock my only seat and prevent matching with B if B comes later. Since I must respond to Student_D’s APPLY with ACCEPT/REJECT (no TALK allowed), I will reject now to preserve the option to accept Student_B later; if B never applies, I can still accept another candidate in a later round, though I risk losing D to other schools. Given D’s strong stated commitment to School_D, they may not have better offers, but I cannot rely on that. Optimal strategy for maximizing my true priority within quota is to hold out for B.

conversation.message: School_D is my first-choice school. I’m applying because I strongly want to attend and would commit to enrolling if accepted. Thank you for considering my application.
conversation.thought: My top choice is School_D, so I should apply immediately. School_D’s priority list ranks me (Student_E) 3rd, behind Student_B and Student_D. If I delay, I risk losing the only seat to one of them. An early, direct application with a clear commitment is my best shot to secure my first choice.

conversation.message: Student_E, thank you for applying to School_D and for your clear commitment to enroll if admitted. After reviewing the applications we received this round, we’re not able to offer you admission at this time. We appreciate your strong interest in School_D and wish you the best in the remainder of the process.
conversation.thought: As School_D with quota 1, my true priority order is B > D > E > C > A. In this round I received APPLY messages from D, E, A, and C (no message from B). Since I can only accept one, I should accept the highest-ranked applicant available now. Student_D is ranked above Student_E, and Student_D also states School_D is first choice and will commit. Therefore, to maximize my outcome on my true priority list, I should reject Student_E for now and (separately) accept Student_D. Student_E is still a strong candidate (3rd), but accepting them would forgo the chance to take Student_D in the same round.

conversation.message: Hello School_D Admissions, I’m Student_A. School_D is my first-choice school, and I’m very eager to join your community. If admitted, I will accept immediately and commit to enrolling. Thank you for considering my application.
conversation.thought: My top true choice is School_D, so I should apply immediately before its single seat fills. Even though School_D ranks me last in its priority list, applying now at least gives me a chance if higher-priority students choose other schools or delay. conversation.message: Student_A, thank you for your application and for your strong interest in School_D. After reviewing the applications received this round, we’re not able to offer you admission at this time. We appreciate your commitment and wish you the best in the remainder of the process.
conversation.thought: As School_D, my true priority ranking is B > D > E > C > A. In this round I received APPLY messages from D, E, A, and C. Student_A is last on my list, so accepting A now would block me from matching with D/E/C, who are all ranked above A and have applied. Therefore I should reject Student_A this round.

Since quota is 1 and we prefer the highest-ranked feasible match, accepting Student_C now secures our #2 choice. Waiting for Student_E is risky because E’s preferences place School_A last, so E is unlikely to apply/accept us. Therefore, accept Student_C to maximize our outcome.

conversation.message: Hello School_A Admissions, I’m Student_A. School_A is one of my top choices, and I’m excited about the chance to join your community. If offered admission, I will accept immediately and commit to enrolling. Thank you very much for your consideration.

conversation.message:

conversation.thought: Our quota is already filled (remaining quota 0) with Student_C, whom we previously accepted and is high on our true priority list (#2). Under the rules, if quota is 0 we must reject any new [APPLY] regardless of the applicant’s rank. Student_A is lower on our priority list than Student_C, and we cannot displace an existing match in this environment, so we must reject.

Therefore, accepting Student_E now maximizes expected outcome given my priorities and the current revealed demand.
